isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - ADJUSTMENTS - KING PIN

step1.para: The front of the vehicle should be raised and properly supported. Front wheels should be off the axle.
The lower kingpin jam nut should be loose or loosened and the lower kingpin ball stud backed down all the way. Refer to Figure 6.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Loosening Lower King Pin Ball Stud

step1.para: Raise the wheel hub, spindle yoke and kingpin bracket assemblies with a hydraulic jack located under the drum. On units with an upper kingpin adjusting screw projecting through the upper kingpin cap or steering arm, adjust the screw to raise the aforementioned parts. Raise unit until the upward movement is resisted by the bottom of the upper kingpin bearing coming into contact with the lower spherical surface of the upper kingpin ball stud.
Put a stack of feeler gauges between the lower kingpin bracket and the suspension yoke. The feeler gauges should fill the gap snugly.
Turn the lower kingpin ball stud upward until the stack of feeler gauges loosen ( Figure 7).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Turning Lower King Pin Ball Stud Upward

step1.para: Back off the lower kingpin ball stud one quarter turn (90°).

Tighten the jam nut to the correct torque while restraining the lower kingpin ball stud from turning. On units with an upper kingpin adjusting screw, back off the screw 1/4 turn. Restrain screw while tightening locknut.

On units without upper adjustment screws, remove the jack or hoist supporting the brake drum. Using a pry bar under the upper kingpin bracket, 1/32 to 3/32-inch play may be observed on a new assembly. After loading, up to 1/8-inch play is acceptable. More than this requires inspection for wear or distortion.
The kingpins should be readjusted after any loosening or removal and reassembly of the upper or lower kingpin brackets, replacement of kingpin bushings, etc.
